Reviews.Title: “Dump at best!”
Reviews.Author: Lightningpao
Reviews.Content: Antiquated hotel with outdated everything. A/C noisey, shower was weak, continental breakfast was GD doughnuts from the 7-11 next door and coffee was one pot...weak! Parking is the wworst. Dont get caught in the middle, if you are first in the normal stalls, you will be "blocked" in by end of the night and have to call the manager to move fking cars so you can get out. BS! Dump, looks good on website, far from the truth!

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking, Free Internet, Decent Location and Cheap..what do you want more?”
Reviews.Author: iaialondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Nov 2008...nothing to write home about but it did the trick...I'm probably now too old to backpack again but I would recommend it to young tourists 'on the road'like we were...

Reviews.Title: “For the price, location, it's a great place”
Reviews.Author: CAMPBELLTOURIST
Reviews.Content: We had to attend a party at the W and were only in hollywood for the evening. So we stayed at this hotel based on the fact that we could walk to the W hotel for a party. It wasnt that bad. It is like any best western or motel 6. The price was very cheap. Parking was free and location was really convenient. We walked to the W at 10pm and walked back at 3 am. Left in the morning and hopped right on the 101, which is really close by. Also there is a CVC store and 7-11 right there (very convenient if you need to pick up bottled water). The owner was really nice as well. I highly reccomend it if you plan just stay there to walk hollywood or do what we did by attending a party at the W without wanting to pay the high price of staying there for just a night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value and Location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: SuperXIX
Reviews.Content: As part of our 2 weeks trip on the West Coast, we really wanted to see Hollywood and the surrounding areas, so we decided on this value hotel just one block north of Hollywood Blvd. We stayed for 4 nights (Aug 19 – 22, 2011) and got a decent deal on Expedia of $90 + tax/night. GOOD: The location is really convenient for walking to Kodak Theatre and the craziness of the Hollywood Blvd as well as a very short driving distance to Universal Studios. We had a rental car and we definitely made use of it in order to see Santa Monica, Malibu, Beverly Hills and Bel Air. The bed was pretty comfortable and the rooms are kept impeccable by some very hard working Spanish ladies. Free Wi-Fi was a bonus. BAD: The continental breakfast is really only donuts and coffee, but I guess it was better than nothing. The street outside can be loud at times especially on the weekend, but it all depends where your room is going to be. We actually had to change our first night room due to the outside noise and we got the room right on top of the alley which was great since it was facing the court and you had no one staying under you. I’d highly recommend this room if you can get it. Also, Expedia did not charge for this hotel upfront so we had to pay for it on the spot. One thing to really watch out for is that if you pay for the rooms, there is no reimbursement if you decide to go somewhere else. The parking lot is usually not sufficient for the number of cars, so be prepared to park blocking other cars and leave your car keys at the front desk so they can move it when needed. Overall, we didn’t spend too much time in the room as we were sightseeing nonstop, but we really liked the convenience of the location, the comfortable room and the great value per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice sized rooms.”
Reviews.Author: truckstopblues
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, the location is convienient for accessing the rest of Hollywood and LA by foot or public transport however as with most of LA it is very loud and I personally felt unsafe at night. Parking is an issue as there are limited spaces and you are asked to park your car in a rather dubious looking car park 1 block up and hand over your keys, however the car was returned safe and sound. The actual motel is well run, impeccably clean and the staff were very helpful. As much as I liked this hotel and it's convienent location I would not stay here again as I personally didn't like the area at night, but others may find it pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but convenient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: diane5636
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 teens) stayed in 2 rooms in late July, 2011. While this is not the most luxurious place we've ever stayed, we get a great deal and the place was adequate. Pluses: Fridge, microwave, internet - all free. One block off Hollywood Blvd, easy walk. Convenience store next door, drugstore down the block. Free parking Room dated, but clean. Front desk and housekeeping very nice. Minuses: A little noisy, N. Cahuenga is a major street. Parking is crowded, if you get in late enough to park along the wall, you have to leave your keys with the desk. Our rooms were on the 2nd floor by the balcony/tables - people were smoking and/or eating meals late and early, you could hear them. Air conditioner worked, but was old and a little hard to figure out. Top sheet and blanket too short to tuck under matress at foot, uncomfortable first night. Pulled them shorter and tucked them myself after that. One box of doughnuts and a coffee machine is not a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: taptaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel both on arrival in Los Angeles and before our flight home. This motel is great value for money. The rooms are not a bad size and we had a king bed which was great. The basin is in the bedroom which is interesting but not a problem. There is a bath/shower, we did have a slight problem with the water temperature but when we mentioned this it was quickly rectified. The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a computer that you can use for making on going bookings, but they do need to get a new keypad as some of the letters on the keys have worn away. It is well situated with just a five minute walk to Hollywood Boulevard from where most of the tour companies leave from. Next to the hotel is a Seven Eleven and laundromat, also across the road is Subway, Chinese restaurant, small supermarket and barber also a big pharmacy that sells everything and I do mean everything. I definitely recommend this hotel you can do it all and not have to pay a fortune, but if you want glitz and glamour this isn't the place for you. Also it is always booked out as people know a good thing when they see one so if you intend to stay there make sure you book well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Anna_and_Greg
Reviews.Content: Advantages: - Good localization (near the main street, but bit a side so it was much more quiet) - Nice and clean non-smoking room - Good air condition system (but bed smell at the begin) - Price is negotiable (You can get about 10 Dollars discount if you ask) Disadvantages: - They take a deposit money and you have to wait long for a return (we are still waiting for it, after one week we do not have it on the bank account) - Continental breakfast (a donut and coffee or tee standing in fron of 'reception' or take it to the room, there are not tables) - No view from the window (only wall)

Reviews.Title: “Convinient for exploring Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: BerlinPeaceFrog
Reviews.Content: The Best Inn is a good value motel within walking distance from walk of fame. Firendly and helpfur owner. For food and drinks check out Solar de Cahuenga across street.

Reviews.Title: “What's with all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: mtlebay
Reviews.Content: I went on my first solo trip to Hollywood last year and found this hotel recommended though online reviews. Although this hotel isn't 5-star, I got a fantastic value with what I paid for, I did feel I was in a safe and clean place. Yes, the motel's a little dated, but the rooms and were clean, everything worked (microwave, fridge, tv, remote, etc...), free internet is free (only one computer but I never waited long), coffee and doughnut in the morning, and friendly service day and night. Because N. Cahuenga can little a little noisy on the busy street and with the club across the street on Saturday night, I requested (as per suggested on TripAdv) the last room in the back, which I got and it was definitely quieter back there. Location is fantastic--2 streets away from Hollywood Blvd, adjacent to the bus, subway system and the sights. If/when I return back to Hollywood, I am definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ballyeden
Reviews.Content: Excellent location one block off of Hollywood Blvd. Room was impeccably clean, All furniture was in good condition. The night manager was helpful with information. Free parking and wi-fi are provided. Neighborhood, (as with much of Hollywood) a bit sketchy. Access to Motel and parking area behind 10 foot courtyard wall and the only entryway goes right by the office window, so we felt reasonably secure. Good for anybody wanting to crash cheaply within blocks of all the main tourist haunts. Not a romantic venue by any means.

Reviews.Title: “WORST Inn Hollywood - DO NOT STAY AT THIS AWFUL PLACE”
Reviews.Author: ijolteon
Reviews.Content: WORST Inn Hollywood - DO NOT STAY AT THIS AWFUL PLACE I had my doubts about booking a hotel with only 2 reviews on Yelp. I should have listened to Sophia C. about this place. They changed the room rate on me when I arrived to a higher rate. This was extremely infuriating, being that I was on a budget. Even though this hotel is advertised as being in the heart of Hollywood, it's not. It's off to the side and is a little bit ghetto there. On Saturday night there was a club right across the street. There were loud cars with loud music, revving up and down the street all night. There were also "interesting" characters walking in front of the hotel at night as well. The rooms are small and dated, a bit dirty. The bathroom wasn't cleaned well. The 1 star is only for the mini fridge and microwave. Don't let the pictures fool you. This place is extremely expensive for what you get, I definitely got ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location minus everything else”
Reviews.Author: anky65
Reviews.Content: The only thing prevented me from giving a poor rating to this hotel is the location. If you are visiting Universal Studios hollywood and get this hotel at very good price, then go for it. Else stay away from this one. The place doesnt look ok for families. The parking is available and free breakfast also, if you can do down early. We were also overcharged, though the amount got refunded later.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Inn" is 100% antonym of meaning word "Best".”
Reviews.Author: Serhiy_Vagabond
Reviews.Content: During our trip through California this was the worst accommodation. The parking capacity is not enough for all guests. Continental breakfast as promoted contained one cup of coffe and one donut. The freshness of bath and rooms since about Elvis's dawn: boxes without handles, mold and bone-crushing sound of extractor in the bathroom - these all aspects gives a little idea about this kennel. "Best Inn" is 100% antonym of meaning word "Best".

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room for value.”
Reviews.Author: Babos23
Reviews.Content: About a 10/15 minute walk to the chinese theatre. Great location for seeing Hollywood. Room basic but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Rates Confusion”
Reviews.Author: cindel25
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with two of my friends and we booked this online. We wanted a double bed but we couldn't booked that so I send an email to the manager who quoted us $90 plus tax. The room was supposed to be $279 however when we checked it the room was $307. As it was told to me, the price went up daily. Needless to say my friends were pissed off because we were on a budget on this trip so each of us had to shell out 10 extra dollars to pay for the room. We could have stay in nicer hotel for $307 in a prime location. That was the only negative for this hotel. Everything is positive; the manager was nice and give us two keys instead of one. The rooms were clean, we had a mini fridge and microwave. The bathroom could have used some work but overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Location, Will def stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mcouldrey
Reviews.Content: We have been to LA/Hollywood 4 times now and usually stay at the Holiday Inn express. We looked for something cheaper and came across the Best Inn. We were unsure at first, but we were very suprised. We stayed 4 nights for under $350. Free internet, carpark and a donut for breakfast. coin laundromat next door and a 7/11. The room was very clean and well worth the money. working fridge and air con/heater. Save your money on the hotel chains. this place will not let you down unless you have high standards and expect 5 star luxury hotels. The only problem we had was, the towels although clean are too small and could use replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I Expected - Great Location, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: Schtacky
Reviews.Content: After a 5-day Carnival cruise, my wife and I decided to check out Hollywood since she had never seen the normal tourist sights. Having stayed in Hollywood before, I don't hold the opinion that visiting it is worth a $200+ per night room. I found this hotel with the help of Tripadvisor, and its reviewers, and found the vast majority of the reviews to be accurate. Overall this is an average hotel in a perfect location for one to check out Hollywood. The stroll from the hotel down to the Walk of Fame and Grauman's Theater takes only minutes; Sunset Blvd, just a little longer. All of the gripes that I had about the room were not the fault of the hotel or its staff. We checked into a non-smoking room only to find that its previous tenants had not only enjoyed several packs of cigarettes, but also some herbal delights. Try as she might, the cleaning lady had a tough time getting rid of the smell and had to resort to approximately 10 gallons of Pinesol, which quickly wore off, believe it or not. Since the hotel was completely booked for a busy film festival, we could not get a different room. My wife is not one to tolerate the smell of cigarettes, so we asked if they would refund our second night and after talking to the manager, she agreed, in part I am sure, since the rate we secured ($75) was well below what they could get from a last minute traveler. While this is certainly no romantic getaway, it's a great value and doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. If I were traveling with friends who were looking to have a great time in the evenings or if I just needed a quick stopover on my way through town, this would be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Handy and satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Karuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Best Inn and found it clean and comfortable after a long trip from Australia. The advertisement was not deceiving and we knew exactly what we were getting into. We had read the reviews for this hotel prior to booking it and were well aware of the issues that it may have. It was good to see that the rooms were clean, were non-smoking (which is particularly an issue in the USA as you can’t always be guaranteed that a non-smoking would be available) and very comfortable having all the necessary items. Breakfast is donuts and coffee (no tea), however, this was advertised and we were quite happy to accept that as we could go across the road and buy something more substantial. If you are on a budget then this is the best place to stay as it is only minutes from the Chinese theatre and you can catch most of the tours from there. We chose this place as it was walking distance to the greyhound station where we took the bus to our next destination. One of the staff was particularly helpful and friendly. As other people have said the doors and walls are quite thin and if your room is next to the main road it can get quite loud especially Friday and Saturday nights. We had very loud neighbours at 3am- tip bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: bunneh
Reviews.Content: If you want to travel to Hollywood and save money to spend on the 'fun' things, then you should stay here. It is a small place-I think only 26 rooms or so, but it in a great location for all the local attractions. The rooms were tidy and simple with a fridge and microwave. Perhaps not my selection for a honeymoon or the like, this is a great and inexpensive place to stay for a weekend adventure.

Reviews.Title: “An OK room in a good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Io_Finland
Reviews.Content: Positive: The location was great - just two blocks from the nearest metro/bus stops and Hollywood Boulevard, so it was a conventient "base". The room wasn't anything special, but it was clean enough and we appreciated having a fridge, microwave oven and AC (although the AC was a little broken - it was either blowing at full speed or off completely). When we left the "do not disturb" sign up, no one bothered us all day. Negative: The walls and doors weren't very good at fending off noise, so the shouting by late night party people and police sirens interrupted our sleep. Although the parking was free, the lot was so small that if you arrive late, you'd have to park in front of other guests' cars and hand over the car keys to the reception. The reception guy went out of his way to help me find a can opener, but my boyfriend received quite mixed service and not all staff spoke decent English. The Internet was free but slow.

Reviews.Title: “excellent excellent”
Reviews.Author: dorseyworld
Reviews.Content: best best and best place to stay in hollywood .centrally located to all major attraction .u dont need to rent acar because everything is close by

Reviews.Title: “SMELLY ROOMS!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: allyouneedislov3
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend have been driving for about 4hrs and were kind of tired, we were going to a concert later that night so we got there early to check in and just rest a little bit, it looked nice from the inside but once we got into our rooms IT SMELLED so bad! we took a nap with the DOORS OPEN, windows open anything to help the smell go away but unfortunately we couldn't do anything about it.. i was trying to take a shower before the show and the showers were broken when i tried to turn on the water, barley anything came out. We went to the front desk, and they were being rude and told us to find the maid, the maid was extremely nice, probably the only reason why i gave this hotel 2 stars instead of 1. They said they would fix our showers in an hour but we had to leave for the show, when we came back our door was open? I'm glad you went in and fixed the shower but why would you ever leave our door open with ALL of our belongings inside?!!? that pissed me off the MOST! extremely lucky that nothing got stolen out of room though. Oh P.S parking really sucks there also..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy place”
Reviews.Author: StevieJana
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms. A cozy place to stay. Good option if you want to stay close to Hollywood. Safe private parking in front of rooms. Only disadvantage: lots of street noise. Wireless internet didn't reach as far as our room. But in general: good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value. Don't expect the Hilton hotel.”
Reviews.Author: garrett678
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night while we visited Hollywood. It was a very convenient walk to the Hollywood tourist spots. However, we decided to drive there since it was late at night when we arrived. Initially, when we first arrived, it felt sketchy. But the room itself was clean with new linen/sheets. We had windows facing the street but the street traffic never disturbed our sleep. Next morning, they had breakfast available (coffee and donuts). The fact that they have FREE parking (a big perk while in LA) and FREE internet (albeit just one computer by the check in window) gives it great value, compared to the outrageous prices out there in Los Angeles. During our stay, there were other young international tourists (mostly europeans), so don't feel like this is a crack house. I highly recommend it to anyone who wishes to travel to LA on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Horribleeeeeeeeee”
Reviews.Author: testdice
Reviews.Content: this is a terrible hotel with very very unfriendly staff and unhygenic... there is a wierd kind of smell..that comes.. and unfortunately cannot be removed.. i finished the whole bottle of air apray and did notthing.. it catches your head as well.. horrible and horrible...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: doogenator
Reviews.Content: First, you should know that this is a budget hotel. So there is no room service, or concierge, and there are squeeky floors, spots missed by housekeeping (no vacuuming under the bed it seems) etc. However we found the staff were very helpful, and there were no problems with check in, general cleanliness etc. The best part is the location. We were staying in LA for 7 nights, so to be 5 minutes walk from Hollywood & Highland was great. The room had 2 double beds, a/c, a fridge and microwave, cable, wifi and a reasonable bathroom. All this for about 30% cheaper than other hotels in the same area. Cahuenga Blvd is relatively nice and safe, and has a discount supermarket and plenty of restaurants/clubs in the very near vicinity. Would recommend to any traveller on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Rooms Nice”
Reviews.Author: BIFF7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for the price ($75). Rooms are good size, very clean, 27" TV. It is not in the best area, but well worth it if you don't want to spend a lot. Parking is the only problem we encountered. There are about 25 rooms, but only 12 spaces. We left our car at a friends house, so I don't really know what would've happened. The management said we would have a space, though. Decent location to Hollywood & Vine, Hollywood Bowl, etc. About 4 miles from Sunset Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Tolua
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights after a 6 month world wide holiday. Location is great about 5 mins walk from central Hollywood. Rooms were large, clean and had more amenities then most other motels we had stayed in. Manager was fairly helpful and we had a great rate of around $60/night from a discount coupon. Best to hire a car as surounding area not great. Overall a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “It's nearly 2007 - get a more recent view point!”
Reviews.Author: PCH94133
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 15 times in the last year! I'm was totally surprised at the other negative reviews hence my thoughts on the subject. Whenever I'm in town I choose to stay here. The staff have always been exceedingly friendly, professional & helpful. In addition the rates are exceedingly good, the rooms are clean & well equipped including fridge, microwave & very efficient air conditioning. I have stayed in a total of about 8 different rooms all of which I have found to be very secure & soundproof. It is centrally located in easy reach of all freeways & is in the shadows of the Hollywood sign. If you are concerned about the area don't be I've always found it to be safe and there is an enclosed parking lot where each car passes the office. As a frequent traveller to LA over the past 13 years I can confidently say that this place competes very favorably with others that are at least twice the price. My advise is stay at least one night & see for yourself .....& enjoy spending the money you've saved on one of the many things LA has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Don't stay here....Seriously!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worse Hotel I have ever stayed in......seriously!!! Got there Friday at 12:00 and was told to wait 30 minutes for the room to be done. Was overcharged $30 for the room (later refunded). Got into the room and after a logn drive wanted to take a shower. Found that the water was going to be off until 6pm. There was a lot of constructiong going on at the hotel at the time. We woke up Saturday morning at 8:00 to the noise of the roof being re done (were not told) about 10 minutes later we get a call saying the water was going to be turned off again and to get up now and shower. Actually we never got the call our friends did and the owner told them to tell us for him. So apart from being woke up we laid in bed for a while trying to relax when the f**kning light falls on our bed. We had to leave the hotel for the entite day to get away from the noise and the fact that we couldn't use the toilet. When asked to refuns money they pretty much said too bad! Worse hotel ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty room, Rude Owners”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the outside this place looked fine but once inside, the room smelled pretty bad. I was exhausted from a day of travel so I just ignored it and went to bed. The next morning I got up to prepare for a job interview. I went to take a shower and found it broken. Being on a time schedule, I did what I could to clean up and get dressed. Upon checking out, I made sure to tell the front desk about the shower so it could be fixed before the next person staying checked in. Instead of being thankful, the Indian girl I spoke to was extremely rude and started yelling at me. Taken by suprise, I tried to understand why she was behaving this way. She started screaming at me, calling me names and saying that I was trying to trick her (with what?). To be honest, I was frightened by her so I got in my car to leave. She followed me to my car screaming obscenities and threatening me to get off her property. I couldn't believe that her parents, who also run the hotel, were standing there as well and did nothing to stop her. Anyone thinking of staying here should not. There are plenty of other hotels in the area for the same price that are much nicer looking and closer to the tourist attractions. This was an extremely unsettling incident that I do not wish on anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for 5 nights and we were totally content. Our intention was to go cheap on accomodations and spend the money on having fun. The rooms are pretty clean and the staff is friendly. My girlfriend thought the shower curtain emitted a foul odour...I did not notice. When they run out of parking you will might have to find pay parking elsewhere. Otherwise, you can park behind someone's car and leave your keys at the front desk. Not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel room in Hollywood close to the Sunset Strip for 2 friends that were going to be in town from the midwest (I was to be joining them, driving up from San Diego). I wanted something near $100, and hadn't even considered the Best Inn until I found it on Trip Advisor and read the preceeding reviews. It had the best reviews by far for budget hotels in the area, and I am soooo glad I chose it. It is a clean little motel with friendly service. The furniture and bedding was nicer than I had expected for a motel in this price range, and the 7 Eleven five steps away is very convenient for anything you need. A cab ride to the Sunset strip is about $15. The Hollywood and Highland complex is even closer. There is no closet, but there is a towel shelf with hangers attached. No bathtub, but a decent shower. They provide plastic tables and chairs (lawn furniture) for you to hang out on and get out of your room w/o leaving the hotel if you don't want to go anywhere, but don't want to be stuck in the room. One group was taking advantage of this with bottles of wine and beers, even. Don't be put off by the somewhat shabby, non-air conditioned check-in "lobby." It is the eyesore of the property and it's not even that bad for the few minutes you're in there. As expected, there was no pool, and soda and ice vending machines only. Free "breakfast" is coffee and donuts from 8-9:30 am. Yes, it is true that the parking lot is small and that it is a good idea to back into your parking space to avoid having to back out onto a busy street (N. Caughenga Blvd). And they only allow one car per hotel room since the lot is small, even though we had a double room with 3 occupants and 2 cars (however, he did let us park the second car in the lot later at night when it was apparent we wouldn't be taking a spot away from another room's car). My only real grievance is that they charged the credit card I had used to hold the room with before we had gotten there, even though that was not the card we were intending to pay with upon checkout. They did not offer to reverse it and take another form of payment instead, but fortuantely for us it did not be that big of a deal, although I'm sure it would have been for somone that used a debit card. My final total for a double with 3 people on a Saturday night, including taxes, was $96.60. I would definitely stay there again when in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Fair place and price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for 14 days. We were backpacking Mexico an ended in Los Angeles. It's location is just perfect for tourist like us. Close to the subway, and all the hollywood atractions. At the same time lots of busses just around the corner. We had a great stay, nice, friendly family, and we didn't have any problems at all. We could stay 5 hours extra in our room on our arrival day so the connection to our europe flight was perfect. The rooms are great big bed, cable, telephone, fridge, microwave, tub, and closet. A perfect stay back in the real world after 2 months in Mexico in various rooms. A good choice with a decent price!

Reviews.Title: “Safety all the way, the best in every way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got there, parked my car and left it. I walked over to Hollywood Boulevard, rode the subway, and had the BEST time in a very long time. The hotel is a class act with safety and real quiet for light sleepers like me. This is a great place to check out for all out of towners....(tourists)--a small suggestion is that there is only one enterance from the street, so park in reverse so you can pull out forward...cause if you pull forward, then you have to back up into a major street. (Just a suggestion that I really wished I'd of done). Anyway, this is a great place, my room was large with a king size bed, entertainment center, microwave & refidgerator...etc. Please do yourself a favor and check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty....Bad that is!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? First of all I arrived at 11:00am, was told the room was not ready yet & to come back at 12pm. I came back and room was still not ready, we had to wait for another 2 hours until we were able to check-in. The room itself is not too bad.A very strong smell of air freshener filled the room and bathroom. The bathroom was the worst.Dingy,dingy,dingy! The toilet barely flushed.If you have to go #2, good luck you're better off using the gas station toilet up the street. The shower was so small and cramped it was difficult to soap up properly, I kept bumping my elbows on the walls. In the morning we were greeted by a wonderful view outside of our window of a homeless(I hope she was hopeless)woman peeing on the street.Complimentary breakfast consisted of a box of donuts and watered down coffee. I don't recommend this place.Look elsewhere I beg you!!

HotelInfo.Name: Best Inn Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 1822 N Cahuenga Blvd, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
